articles.author: Neia Balao
articles.title: The Orionid meteor shower peaks tonight: When and where to view the debris from Halley's comet - Yahoo
articles.description: The meteors, per the American Meteor Society, are active annually from around Oct. 2 to Nov. 7 and can each streak up to 148,000 mph.
articles.content:
A spectacular celestial display will soon be visible. The Orionid meteor shower, which is known to produce fireballs on occasion, is expected to peak overnight Wednesday, according to NASA.
